name: Parallel and Distributed Operating Systems Group
intro: We at PDOS build and investigate software systems for parallel and distributed environments, and have conducted research in systems verification, operating systems, multi-core scalability, security, networking, mobile computing, language and compiler design, and systems architecture. PDOS builds high-performance, reliable, and working systems. We are part of MIT CSAIL.See our publications for more details about our research.We work concurrently on a number of research projects. Our currently active research projects can be roughly grouped into the following categories.

2022: Verifying the DaisyNFS concurrent and crash-safe file system with sequential reasoning
Verifying hardware security modules with information-preserving refinement
Verifying a concurrent, crash-safe file system with sequential reasoning
Vivid: An operating system kernel for radiation-tolerant flight control software
GoTxn: Verifying a crash-safe, concurrent transaction system
Understanding and improving the performance of mitigating transient execution attacks
2021: GoJournal: a verified, concurrent, crash-safe journaling system
Privacy heroes need data disguises
rtlv: push-button verification of software on hardware
Guarda: A web application firewall for WebAuthn transaction authentication
Kronos: Verifying leak-free reset for a system-on-chip with multiple clock domains

name: Amsterdam Machine Learning Lab
intro: The Amsterdam Machine Learning Lab (AMLab) conducts research in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and its applications to large scale data domains in science and industry. This includes the development of deep generative models, methods for approximate inference, probabilistic programming, Bayesian deep learning, causal inference, reinforcement learning, graph neural networks, and geometric deep learning.AMLab comprises 7 faculty. Max Welling and Jan-Willem van de Meent serve as co-directors. Herke van Hoof, Patrick Forr√©, Eric Nalisnick, Erik Bekkers, and Christian Naesseth serve as tenure-track faculty. The lab participates in partnerships with industry through the QUvA Lab (with Qualcomm) and the Delta Lab (with Bosch). The lab also engages in cross-disciplinary collaborations through the AI4Science Lab.

name: Carnegie Mellon Database Group
intro: The Database Group at Carnegie Mellon University is a leading research collective that focuses on database systems, data mining, and machine learning. We participate in a number of cross-disciplinary research efforts, and closely collaborate with other groups at CMU.

2022: Tastes Great! Less Filling! High Performance and Accurate Training Data
Are You Sure You Want to Use MMAP in Your Database Management System?
2021: MB2: Decomposed Behavior Modeling for Self-Driving Database Management Systems
